tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE EmployeePerformanceData (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name TEXT,
    performance_rating INT,
    department TEXT,
    hire_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50),
    last_name VARCHAR(50),
    department_id INT,
    hire_date DATE,
    termination_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE performance_reviews (
    review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    review_date DATE,
    review_score INT,
    reviewer_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE Employee (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_name VARCHAR(255),
    department VARCHAR(100),
    hire_date DATE,
    salary DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE PerformanceReview (
    review_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    review_date DATE,
    rating INT,
    comments TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Training (
    training_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    training_name VARCHAR(255),
    trainer_name VARCHAR(100),
    duration_hours INT,
    cost DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE EmployeeTraining (
    emp_training_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    training_id INT,
    completion_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES Employee(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (training_id) REFERENCES Training(training_id)
);
CREATE TABLE Employee { employee_id INT, name VARCHAR(50), department VARCHAR(50), hire_date DATE }
CREATE TABLE PerformanceReview { review_id INT, employee_id INT, review_date DATE, review_rating INT }
CREATE TABLE Training { training_id INT, training_name VARCHAR(50), department VARCHAR(50), trainer VARCHAR(50) }
CREATE TABLE Salary { employee_id INT, salary_amount DECIMAL(10,2), currency VARCHAR(5), effective_date DATE }
CREATE TABLE Promotion { promotion_id INT, employee_id INT, new_position VARCHAR(50), promotion_date DATE }
